designSystem.name: CloudAGI Design System
designSystem.description: A modern, sophisticated design system with smooth animations, elegant typography, and a refined color palette optimized for AI-powered applications.

corePrinciples: Minimalism with Purpose - Clean interfaces that prioritize content and functionality
Motion as Communication - Animations guide users and provide feedback, never distract
Accessibility First - All interactions must be accessible and respect reduced motion preferences
Responsive by Default - Mobile-first approach with seamless scaling to desktop
Dark Mode Native - Dark mode is not an afterthought but a core design consideration
Performance Conscious - Smooth 60fps animations with optimized rendering
designPhilosophy.aesthetic: Modern minimalist with subtle luxury touches. Think Apple meets Stripe - clean, professional, with carefully crafted micro-interactions.

colorSystem.philosophy: Uses OKLCH color space for perceptually uniform colors and better dark mode transitions. Colors maintain their perceived brightness and saturation across themes.

background.description: Pure white background for maximum contrast and clarity

primary.description: Dark primary for buttons and CTAs

muted.description: Subtle backgrounds for less prominent elements

border.description: Light gray borders for subtle separation

destructive.description: Warm red for errors and destructive actions

primary.description: Light primary for dark mode contrast

border.description: Subtle white borders with low opacity

destructive.description: Brighter red for dark mode visibility

usage.background: Use for page backgrounds and main containers
usage.card: Use for card components, modals, and elevated surfaces
usage.primary: Use for primary actions, buttons, and brand elements
usage.secondary: Use for secondary actions and less prominent elements
usage.muted: Use for subtle backgrounds, disabled states, and tertiary content
usage.accent: Use for hover states and interactive highlights
usage.border: Use for borders, dividers, and subtle separations
usage.destructive: Use for errors, warnings, and destructive actions

sans.name: Geist Sans
sans.usage: Primary font for all UI text, headings, and body content
sans.characteristics: Modern, clean, highly legible, geometric sans-serif

mono.name: Geist Mono
mono.usage: Code blocks, technical content, and monospace requirements

weights.light: 300 - Rarely used, for very subtle emphasis

usage.componentPadding: p-4 to p-8 (16px-32px) for cards and containers
usage.sectionSpacing: py-16 to py-32 (64px-128px) for major sections
usage.elementGaps: gap-2 to gap-6 (8px-24px) for flex/grid layouts
usage.containerMaxWidth: max-w-5xl to max-w-7xl (1024px-1280px) for content containers

usage.buttons: rounded-md to rounded-full depending on style

shadows.philosophy: Subtle, layered shadows that provide depth without being heavy

levels.xs: shadow-xs - Minimal shadow for subtle elevation

special.backdropBlur: backdrop-blur-lg - For glassmorphism effects on headers and overlays
special.ring: ring-[3px] ring-ring/50 - Focus states with subtle ring
special.glow: Custom glow effects for interactive elements on hover

grid.columns: 1 column mobile, 2-4 columns tablet, 4-6 columns desktop
grid.gap: gap-4 to gap-8 (16px-32px) depending on content density

sections.horizontalSpacing: px-4 to px-6 on mobile, px-6 to px-24 on desktop

button.philosophy: Clear hierarchy with distinct variants for different action importance

special.interactiveHover: Custom button with animated dot and sliding text effect

card.philosophy: Elevated surfaces that group related content with subtle depth

variants.default: Standard card with border and shadow

sections.header: CardHeader with title and optional action

input.philosophy: Clean, accessible inputs with clear focus states

base.style: h-9 w-full rounded-md border border-input bg-transparent px-3 py-1

header.philosophy: Sticky navigation that provides context without distraction

navigation.mobile: Full-screen overlay menu with backdrop blur

footer.philosophy: Clean, organized footer with subtle visual interest

style.accent: Top border with subtle blur effect

footer.layout: Grid layout with logo, links, and social icons

expandableCards.philosophy: Interactive cards that reveal content on selection with smooth animations

animation.content: Blur-in effect (blur(5px) to blur(0px)) with opacity fade

interaction.selected: Expands to reveal additional content panel

statsCards.philosophy: Animated metric cards that draw attention to key numbers

style.animation: Staggered entrance animations with spring physics

statsCards.layout: Grid: 1 column mobile, 2 columns tablet, 4 columns desktop

elements.icon: Animated icon with rotation and scale
elements.value: Large, bold number with scale animation
elements.label: Uppercase, tracking-wide label

textAnimation.philosophy: Text that comes alive through carefully choreographed animations

types.scaleUp: Scale from 0.5 to 1 with spring physics

segments.character: Animate by character for dramatic effect

animations.philosophy: Motion should feel natural, purposeful, and performant. Use spring physics for organic movement.

principles.purpose: Every animation should serve a purpose - feedback, guidance, or delight
principles.performance: Target 60fps, use transform and opacity for GPU acceleration
principles.timing: Fast enough to feel responsive (200-300ms), slow enough to be perceived (not < 100ms)

commonPatterns.slideIn: Translate from off-screen with opacity fade
commonPatterns.blurIn: Filter blur(10px) to blur(0px) with opacity

interactions.hover: Subtle scale (1.05-1.1), shadow increase, color transition
interactions.click: Brief scale down (0.95) then back up

gradients.radial: radial-gradient for footer and special sections

glassmorphism.usage: Headers, floating elements, cards over media

smoothCursor.philosophy: Custom cursor that follows mouse with spring physics
smoothCursor.style: Custom SVG cursor with rotation based on velocity
smoothCursor.interaction: Scales down slightly on fast movement

responsiveDesign.approach: Mobile-first - Design for mobile, enhance for larger screens

patterns.navigation: Hamburger menu on mobile, horizontal nav on desktop
patterns.grid: 1 column mobile, 2-4 columns tablet, 4+ columns desktop
patterns.typography: Smaller text on mobile, larger on desktop
patterns.spacing: Tighter spacing on mobile, more generous on desktop
patterns.containers: Full width mobile, max-width containers on desktop

accessibility.colorContrast: WCAG AA minimum, AAA where possible
accessibility.focusStates: Visible focus rings (3px) on all interactive elements
accessibility.reducedMotion: Respect prefers-reduced-motion, disable animations when requested
accessibility.ariaLabels: Proper ARIA labels for screen readers
accessibility.semanticHTML: Use proper HTML elements (nav, header, main, footer, etc.)

implementation.styling: Tailwind CSS with custom theme configuration
implementation.colorSystem: CSS custom properties with OKLCH color space
implementation.themeToggle: System preference detection with manual override

utilities.cn: Utility function for conditional class names (clsx + tailwind-merge)

designTokens.summary: All design decisions are tokenized through CSS custom properties and Tailwind config
designTokens.customProperties: Defined in globals.css, accessible via var(--property-name)
designTokens.tailwindIntegration: Tokens mapped to Tailwind utilities for consistent usage
designTokens.themeAware: All tokens automatically adapt to light/dark mode

whenCreatingComponents: Use design tokens, not hardcoded values
Test in both light and dark modes
Add smooth transitions for state changes
Use spring animations for natural movement
spacingRules: Maintain visual rhythm with consistent gaps
More spacing for major sections, less for related elements
typographyRules: Use Geist Sans for all UI text
Maintain clear hierarchy with size and weight
Use appropriate line height for content type
Reserve Geist Mono for code and technical content
colorRules: Always use semantic color tokens (primary, secondary, etc.)
Never hardcode colors - use theme-aware tokens
Test contrast ratios in both themes
Use muted colors for less important content
Reserve primary color for key actions
animationRules: Use spring physics for natural movement
Stagger animations for lists and groups
Provide static fallbacks for reduced motion
Animate transform and opacity for performance
